New Records: Sri Lanka scored their lowest total in T20I history with 77 runs against South Africa in the 2024 T20 World Cup match.
Anrich Nortje delivered a career-best performance with 4 wickets for 7 runs in the match.
Ottneil Baartman and Keshav Maharaj also contributed significantly to South Africa's bowling success.
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka's batting collapsed, losing wickets at regular intervals without substantial resistance.
The match was one-sided due to challenging pitch conditions and an ineffective Sri Lankan batting lineup.
South Africa's disciplined bowling led to Sri Lanka's historic low score.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was anticipated to be competitive but turned into a one-sided affair due to poor batting performance.
The New York pitch was challenging with inconsistent bounce and swing, impacting the batting side.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka's performance raised questions about their preparation and adaptability.
South Africa's bowlers were praised for their dominant display, especially Anrich Nortje's contribution.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match resulted in Sri Lanka's fifth-lowest total in T20 World Cup history.
Sri Lanka's inability to build partnerships was a key factor in their loss.
The match was the first at the New York venue in the tournament.
Others: Kusal Mendis was the top scorer for Sri Lanka with 19 runs off 30 balls.
